com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.virtualization
Class VirtualizedSystem

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.virtualization.VirtualizedSystem

public class VirtualizedSystem
extends Object

A VirtualizedSystem encapsulates state and functionality typically defined by the Java System class.

This is primarily used for creating, isolating and executing Java applications in-process as pseudo processes, in much the same was as an application server or container would do for a Java EE application.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Constructor Detail

VirtualizedSystem

public VirtualizedSystem(AvailablePortIterator portIterator)
Constructs a VirtualizedSystem based on the current System resources.

The resulting VirtualizedSystem is actually the real system represented as a VirtualizedSystem.

Parameters:
portIterator - the AvailablePortIterator for requesting system ports.

VirtualizedSystem

public VirtualizedSystem(String name,
                         VirtualizedSystem system)
Constructs a VirtualizedSystem based on another VirtualizedSystem.

Parameters:
name - the name of the VirtualizedSystem
system - the VirtualizedSystem from which to inherit system resources

VirtualizedSystem

public VirtualizedSystem(String name,
                         VirtualizedSystem system,
                         VirtualizedMBeanServerBuilder mBeanServerBuilder)
Constructs a VirtualizedSystem based on another VirtualizedSystem.

Parameters:
name - the name of the VirtualizedSystem
system - the VirtualizedSystem from which to inherit system resources
mBeanServerBuilder - the VirtualizedMBeanServerBuilder for the VirtualizedSystem

VirtualizedSystem

Constructs a VirtualizedSystem.

Parameters:
name - the name of the VirtualizedSystem
properties - the system Properties
stdout - the standard out
stderr - the standard err
mBeanServerBuilder - the VirtualizedMBeanServerBuilder
